chapter.para: Data Patterns is a Library and ECL bundle that primarily serves as a data profiling tool to give an analysis of a dataset in HPCC.
In many places within this document "Data Patterns" is used to mean "data profiling".

Data Patterns allows you to see if values in fields of the dataset are optimally represented by its data type, and other general information such as extreme values, averages, and other numerical constants. One record is provided for each field analyzed.
The analysis provided by the tool allows you to gain an understanding of the general sense of a dataset.
Data Patterns can be invoked in three ways:

listitem.para: Using the Std.DataPatterns Module in ECL

chapter.para: The installations have differences. Using Data Patterns in ECL watch only supports data profiling and optimization but automatically includes visualizations. The ECL Standard Library does not support visualizations.
There are numerous parameters for controlling output and analysis:

listitem.para: Analyze all rows of a data set or just a sample
Analyze all fields or certain fields only
